item.title: BI Consultant, Enterprise Data and Analytics Enablement
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

BI Consultant, Enterprise Data & Analytics Enablement

Enterprise Data & Analytics Enablement  team employ tailored approach to support each LoB strategy and transform and accelerate the BI/Analytics (BIA) experience within CIBC. We are here to enable our business partners to seamlessly adopt data analytics tools and capabilities and make data-driven decisions in an efficient and secured manner.

As a BI Consultant you will design and carry out the development of BI solutions and services leveraging a wide variety of BI tools. The incumbent will be responsible for data integration from multiple data sources, analyzing business needs and requirements, providing an informed opinion or recommendation on opportunities to optimize business intelligence for the benefit of our business partners, employees, and shareholders.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • The BI Consultant will design and build end to end  BI/Analytics solutions that includes data preparation, KPIs and Metrics development,  testing and implementation activities utilizing various tools - Tableau, Alteryx, ThoughtSpot, Power BI, T-SQL  etc.

  • Identify opportunities to automate, streamline processes that will bring in efficiency in data reporting and analytical environments, lessen manual intervention and increase end user efficiency.

  • Lead and partner with Business Analytics, Technology, Enterprise Architecture, and other business groups with a focus of fostering Data & BI/Analytics research and innovation culture

What We’re Looking For

  • Practical knowledge and hands on experience in the area of Data Engineering, BI and Data Analytic, Big Data, Cloud environment.

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau, Alteryx, Power BI,  T-SQL (MS SQL). Having exposure to Python, HTML is an asset.

  • Presentation, interactive/analytical skills sufficient to convey both factual and conceptual information utilizing methodologies as  Rapid BI, Design Thinking and Storytelling.

  • Business analysis and consulting skills to precisely articulate & understand business requirements and ideas that involve interpretation, analysis, assessment and implementation. 

  • Working knowledge of CIBC’s organizational structure, facilities, policies, processes, products and operating procedures, guidelines and systems is preferable. 

  • Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 21st Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Technology (Inactive)

item.title: Sr Manager, Data Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) is responsible for the identification, measurement and monitoring of all operational risks throughout the bank. Within GORM, the Advanced Analytics team provides data science expertise and best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms, responsible for data management, analysis, delivery and insight creation. The Senior Manager, Data Science primary responsibilities include working with the Advanced Analytics team and the GORM partners to analyze and model operational risk data to identify insights in order to mitigate risks.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you’ll succeed

  • Model Development Skills – Developing advanced models to extract insights from large volumes of structured and unstructured data using programming languages such as Python.

  • Manage Production Models – Drive actions and reduce risk by managing statistical and machine learning models, which include monitoring model performance.

  • Database Skills – Accessing massive datasets by using advanced SQL/relational database knowledge.  Experience designing databases, tables, views, complex queries and stored procedures.

  • Data Visualization Skills -  Translating data to insights by authoring strategic dashboards intended for the broader GORM team, senior leaders and executives. Requires skills using Tableau or similar interactive data visualization business intelligence applications.

  • Curious and Creative – Innovative and likes to try new concepts and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive

  • Planning and Coordination - Effectively interact with all stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements, prepare design specifications, and provide technical support for applications, as instructed by senior team members.

  • Stay Current with Best Practices – Constantly looking for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, staying up to date with industry best practices in data management tools and big data analytics

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning, time-series analysis and predictive modeling. Good understanding of business environment (preferably financial industry) and the ability to apply machine learning techniques to solve business challenges.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, and/or a related field of study or relevant work/project experience

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics (RESL)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing­­

The Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking Real Estate Secured Lending product line. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader and subject matter expert in Real Estate Secured Lending– Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements

  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.

  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.

  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.

  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).

  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Actionable Insights, Advanced Analytics, Alteryx, Big Data, Consulting, Dashboard Creation, Dashboards Design, IBM Cognos Business Intelligence, Problem Solving, Python, R Code, SAS Platform, Statistics, Structured Query Language (SQL), Tableau, Taking Initiative

item.title: Senior Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Client Analytics and Forecasting team has the objective to provide senior management with the necessary information for the retail lending portfolios so they have a good understanding of the risk profile of the existing portfolios which is critical to ensuring the sustainable performance that CIBC’s risk appetite demands.

As a Senior Consultant Client Analytics and Forecasting, you will be developing advanced statistical models that evaluate credit risk and stress testing across a variety of retail credit portfolios including credit cards, personal loans and lines of credit, residential mortgages and small business loans. You will also contribute to the profitable growth of personal lending portfolios by independently and proactively performing the activities that support the performance monitoring, portfolio loss forecasting and analytics for the credit cards, residential mortgages, secured and unsecured lines/loans portfolios including student loans. Also, the successful candidate will write technical model documentation to support the model vetting and validation process. You will also improve forecasting processes and methodologies, identify weaknesses and close the gap of inefficiencies, explore new data sources, and develop deeper understanding of clients.

Proactively identify opportunities within the personal lending portfolio operations where analytical techniques can be effectively applied to achieve core business objectives. Consulting with business partners, assessing each unit’s needs and developing an analytical plan to demonstrate the range of options and potential impacts.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in Economics, Finance or other applicable discipline.
  • You have a graduate degree in areas with exposure to statistical or machine learning coursework (Statistics, Math, Data Analytics, Economics, Finance, Data Science).
  • You can demonstrate experience in working with SAS (Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner) or similar analytical tools (i.e. SQL, Python, R), Tableau, VBA, Excel macros, Hyperion Essbase planning systems and databases.
  • You can develop and execute statistical/machine learning models for all retail risk systems. Understand and generate critical actionable insights from data.
  • You have good understanding of stress testing models, credit cards, residential mortgages, secured/unsecured lines and loans business.
  • You are familiar with best practices in forecasting methodologies and innovative analytical tools, and can leverage this knowledge to enhance NCL management strategies.
  • You are proficient in Financial Analysis and develop and maintain models to forecast retail lending NCL. Complete trend, performance and variance analysis; reviewing financial information to ensure risks are identified and underlying causes of variances are understood. Provide financial impacts of various scenarios and “what if” situations; develop specialized reporting and performs ad-hoc analysis.
  • You will ensure the timely, accurate and informative delivery of “forward looking” information to assist in senior leader decision support. This includes preparation of the NCL Annual Financial Plan, Quarterly Financial Forecasts and Latest Estimates. In addition, this position provides guidance on planning and forecasting NCL for the retail lending portfolio while acting as the central consolidator of this information. This role also involved in the ongoing analysis and interpretation of NCL to ensure relevant issues are highlighted to senior management.
  • You will prepare and communicate insightful analysis including, variance analyses and prior period performance.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You are skillful in evaluating complex data relationships and developing fact based reports and presentations on the knowledge gained from the analysis; being able to generate insights and recommend solutions to problems and present the outcomes.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

How You’ll Succeed

  • You exhibit CIBC’s values of trust, team work, and accountability
  • You will frequently liaise with other departments to establish collaborative relationships, provide expertise, and communicate forecasting estimates.
  • You will be responsible for data-driven forecasts that enhance efficiency and predictability.
  • You are keen in problem solving
  • You process good writing and visual presentation skills sufficient to articulate the results of analysis performed
  • You have well-developed communication skills to facilitate development of good working relationships within CIBC
  • You are able to execute job functions with minimal supervision

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan 

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 10th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Microsoft Excel Macros, SAS Enterprise, SAS Enterprise Miner, SAS SQL, Stress Testing, Structured Query Language (SQL), VBA Macro

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Small Business Risk Management, the successful candidate will be well versed in designing, building and implementing account acquisition and account management strategies with a focus on increasing auto-approval rates and decreasing loss rates. Expert level SAS SQL coding skills are required to extract value from data combined with strong communication skills for presentation of risk-reward analysis to Senior Management. Reporting (standard and ad hoc) will require attention to detail and accuracy.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data driven - Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives.   Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with  practical industry experience is required.
    • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance
    • Conduct pre and post-analyses of strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance
    • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria. 
    • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team
  • Continuous improvement mindset - Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
  • Communication and relationship management - Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities.  Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
    • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Critical thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions.  You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
  • Project execution - Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in at least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS SQL (required); comfort with exploring how new and emerging data can be used; Knowledge of data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau, etc. is an asset. Working in applied data & analytics problems in business banking and/or retail banking is an asset.  Experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset. Experience is developing business requirements documents and solutions requirements documents with Technology is an asset.
    • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
    • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
    • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Regular

item.title: Risk Analytics Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) is responsible for the identification, measurement and monitoring of all operational risks throughout the bank. Within GORM the Advanced Analytics team provides data science expertise and best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms, responsible for data management, analysis, delivery and insight creation.  The Risk Analyst’s primary responsibilities include working with the Advanced Analytics team and the GORM partners to analyze and visualize operational risk data to identify insights in order to mitigate risks.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Visualization Skills – Translating data to insights by authoring strategic dashboards intended for the broader GORM team, senior leaders and executives. Requires skills using Tableau or similar interactive data visualization business intelligence applications.

  • Database Skills – Accessing massive datasets by using advanced SQL/relational database knowledge.  Experience designing databases, tables, views, complex queries and stored procedures.

  • Programing Skills – You have hands-on programming experience using Python.

  • Data Management – Supporting the ongoing day-to-day data ETL operations. Proactively participate in the analysis and resolution of problems adversely affecting the efficiency or integrity of the data

  • Data Modelling Skills – Assisting in the sourcing and building of ETL pipelines for new data sources for analytical/data visualization projects in GORM and its business partners 

  • Curious and Creative – Innovative and likes to try new concepts and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive

  • Planning and Coordination - Effectively interact with all stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements, prepare design specifications, and provide technical support for applications, as instructed by senior team members.

  • Stay Current with Best Practices – Constantly looking for ways to improve user experience and insights consumption, staying up to date with industry best practices in data management tools and big data analytics

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: supporting the end-to-end process for creating and managing visualization pipeline (e.g., sourcing data, database organization and structuring, creating ETL pipelines, and designing dashboards).

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, and/or a related field of study or relevant work/project experience

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Decision Science team is a central hub of data science expertise within Personal and Business Banking, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms to truly revolutionize personalization to drive client experience. The Senior Data Scientist ensures that sound analytical methods and processes are followed and predictive models are built on sound data samples. As a Senior Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve a wide range of challenging business problems and bring innovative solutions. This position pro-actively contributes to the portfolio management function in the area of model design, model building, model governance and model performance monitoring and other analysis to help optimize the effectiveness and profitability of projects, marketing campaigns, pricing, optimization, contracts and other business decisions across our products. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from Products, Segments, Marketing to Channels and Risk. You will work with structured and unstructured data to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: Provide advanced analytics solutions to solve business problems by leveraging traditional statistical, machine learning and optimization techniques. Ability to conduct self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems.
  • Modeler: Participate in model development by conducting detailed quantitative analysis work to support the model development. Support deploying statistics and machine learning models in development and production environments. Work closely with other senior modelers to facilitate effective dissemination of model related documents and model governance and model performance to business partners.
  • Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners.
  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large multivariate datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, Spark). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as SAS, R or Python. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages in SAS EG and Enterprise Miner. Experience with MS Office and Tableau is an asset.
  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and a Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you\'ll be doing

As a member of the Asset Management team and under the direction of the Director, Data Management & Research, you are lead the Data Management & Research team (formerly known as Investment Data Management team) to perform their tasks efficiently and in a timely manner as well as serving as the main point of contact on any data related platforms in scope of the team in regards to data issues/requests. As the Senior Manager, Data Management & Research , you make sure to keep a teamwork, trust and accountability focus environment within the team. You are leading the creation and enhancement of Data Management protocols (including data governance, data quality, data integration, data security etc.) for all data sources and processes required by the various teams at CAM with a focus on the investment teams. As Senior Manager, you also collaborate with other business partners on the development and evolution of the data model used by the current Business Intelligent solution.

You are flexible to work our support coverage hours which may include evenings and/or weekends to deliver a high service level to our data consumers.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1 or 2 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you\'ll succeed

item.description:

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Advanced Analytics you will be a senior contributor to the delivery of the Data Analytics’ (DA) strategy, plan and projects within Internal Audit (IA). The Senior Consultant will work closely with the DA and IA teams to leverage analytics in order to provide assurance to the bank through our support of audit engagements, continuous monitoring and auditing programs, as well as proactive, strategic, and ad-hoc analysis of trending and emerging risks.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role.  You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you’ll succeed

  • Leverage advanced analytics, modeling, and statistical knowledge to design, implement, and deliver analytics engagements in support of Internal Audit partners. Actively lead assigned complex data analytics engagements to ensure quality, depth of analysis, and clearly communicated and insightful results.
  • Design and create interactive dashboards to support visual analytics projects and create continuous monitoring and auditing programs, data profiles and KPI/KRI dashboards.
  • Work closely with IA and other stakeholders to understand the controls environment of the bank, inherent and emerging risks, and scope of engagement for the deployment of data analytics.
  • Actively participate in the audit life-cycle activities; contribute as data & analytics Subject Matter Expert in scope and planning discussions, in designing and implementing the analytics engagement, and in delivery and presentation to stakeholders, including IA and Auditee executives.
  • Provide technical, motivational and strategic thought leadership to the Advanced Analytics team in planning and executing in-depth data analysis supporting a variety of audit activities.
  • Collaborate with other consultants and leaders in the CIBC analytics community to identify and realize points of integration to deliver coordinated analytics services to Internal Audit.

Who you are

  • A degree (preferably at the graduate level) in Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, or Business. Strategic and systematic thinker with a strong analytical and process development background.
  • 5+ years of experience and advanced practical and theoretical knowledge in data analytics, quantitative modeling, BI or statistical analysis
  • Progressive experience in the data analytics field including product, client or risk analytics. Prior experience in Assurance Analytics (Risk, Compliance, Audit) is a definite asset.
  • Great communication skills, verbal and written as well as a great storyteller who can visually bring to life what data and analytics is showing us.

The Decision Science team is a central hub of data science expertise within Personal and Business Banking, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms to truly revolutionize personalization to drive client experience. The Senior Data Scientist ensures that sound analytical methods and processes are followed and predictive models are built on sound data samples. As a Senior Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve a wide range of challenging business problems and bring innovative solutions. This position pro-actively contributes to the portfolio management function in the area of model design, model building, model governance and model performance monitoring and other analysis to help optimize the effectiveness and profitability of projects, marketing campaigns, pricing, optimization, contracts and other business decisions across our products. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from Products, Segments, Marketing to Channels and Risk. You will work with structured and unstructured data to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment.

Support deploying statistics and machine learning models in development and production environments. Work closely with other senior modelers to facilitate effective dissemination of model related documents and model governance and model performance to business partners.
  • Business Consulting: Conduct business problem assessment independently. Gather relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility and quality. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach to solve a business problem. Perform in-depth analysis for the purpose of identifying revenue generation and cost saving opportunities, developing proposals and make recommendations for model usage to the downstream partners.
  • Market Relevancy: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Enhance existing processes for reporting and monitoring

·       We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

item.title: Senior Quantitative Analyst – IFRS 9 & Stress Testing
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

In this role you will work under guidance of the Senior Director, and will be part of a team responsible for the design, development, documentation, and implementation of Stress Testing and Forecasting Models for the Bank’s credit portfolios (retail and wholesale).

How You’ll Succeed

  • Design and Develop - You will contribute to the design, development, documentation, implementation, use, and monitoring of credit stress testing / forecasting models for the Wholesale and Retail portfolios.
  • Use of Models – You will estimate probabilities of default, regulatory capital requirements and potential losses under stress/forecasted scenarios for the Wholesale and Retail portfolios at the bank or business level for the purposes of (i) Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process (ICAAP), (ii) regulatory stress testing exercises, (iii) the assessment of risks at the business level, and (iv) IFRS 9 Expected Credit Loss under forward looking information.
  • Analytics – You will work on various ad-hoc credit risk analytics.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree (M.Sc. or Ph.D.) in a quantitative (finance / economics / statistics / mathematics / management science / computer science) field.
  • You demonstrate solid experience in credit risk quantification (PD, LGD and EAD) and time series modeling. Expert knowledge of SAS and its statistical procedures and techniques. Other knowledge of statistical and programing tools an asset.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.
